definition-item.definition-title: CYCLES; CYCLE FRAMES; CYCLE STEERING DEVICES; RIDER-OPERATED TERMINAL CONTROLS SPECIALLY ADAPTED FOR CYCLES; CYCLE AXLE SUSPENSIONS; CYCLE SIDE-CARS, FORECARS, OR THE LIKE

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Cycle frames, steering, controls, suspension arrangements vehicles with more than three wheels and cycle side cars, forecars and trailers.
Multiple classification should be given if appropriate.
Where applicable, additional classification should also be givenusing the following Indexing Codes:
B62K2201/00 Springs used in cycle frames or parts thereof;
B62K2202/00 Motorized scooters;
B62K2204/00 Adaptations for driving cycles by electric motor (for driving electrically assisted bicycles B62M6/00).

section-body.paragraph-text: In B62K11/00 cycle should be interpreted like a moped, with more emphasis on the motorcycle, rather than a bicycle with motor/engine assist which should be in B62M6/00. All unicycles should be in B62K1/00. Any specific frame modification specifically for mounting an engine or motor which are relevant to non-pedalled cycles (with less than 3 wheels) should be classified here.

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

section-body.paragraph-text: Balancing machines having a single main ground engaging wheel should be further classified in B62K1/00 for unicycles.
If there is an additional support wheel (see ref. 4 in the second figure) the device will still be considered a unicycle.

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of accessories to be classified here may be a pair of rear wheels, not training wheels, mounted to a common bicycle to convert it to a tricycle or skis attachable to the wheels of the conventional cycle to adapt it for snow.

definition-item.definition-title: Sidecars; Forecars; {Trailers or the like specially adapted to be attached to cycles} (trailers B60P; B62D; characterised by carrying propulsion engine {B62M7/14})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Additional wheeled units that can be attached to the side of the cycle (sidecars) or the rear of the cycle (trailers) or the front of the cycle (forecars).

table-column.paragraph-text: Trailers for carrying other vehicles
Trailers in general
Characterised by trailer carrying propulsion engine
Hand carts

section-body.paragraph-text: All trailers for bicycles are classified in group B62K27/003 and circulated to B62D63/06 for trailers in general.

Wheeled units are not always trailers or cars. The wheeled unit, i.e. the platform or frame with a wheel on it, is attached to the side, front or rear. So-called trailers are attached to the rear and are classified in subgroup B62K27/003 and should also be considered for trailers in general (B62D).
